stories.body:
Investing.com - Alors que les actions technologiques de croissance perdent en puissance, de nombreux analystes parient sur une rotation qui verrait le marché haussier profiter davantage profiter à d'autres types d'actions.
 Or, c'est la baisse des taux de la Fed qui sera le signal déclencheur de cette inversion de tendance, selon l'économiste Jeremy Siegel, professeur de finance de la Wharton School qui souligné dans une récente intervention sur CNBC les opportunités qui se cachent dans les actions de valeur.
  ⚠️ InvestingPro est en soldes ! Laissez l'IA choisir pour vous les meilleures actions comme plus de 150.000 investisseurs qui surperforment le marché sans efforts ! Rejoignez la révolution pour moins de 8 euros par mois en
  cumulant
  les soldes d'été et la réduction réservée à nos lecteurs pour un
  rabais total de -43%
  * sur l'abonnement d'un an !
  ⚠️
  ▶ Cliquez ici pour accéder à la réduction spéciale en plus des soldes d'été
  (réduction totale de -43%*) pour l'abonnement Pro de 1 an (qui revient à 7.4 euros par mois)
  Les doutes sur l'IA et la baisse des taux de la Fed vont favoriser une rotation de la croissance vers la valeur
  Rappelons en effet que la frénésie autour des investissements liés à l'IA a, jusqu'à récemment, permis aux grandes actions technologiques de surperformer. Cependant, les doutes s'accumulent quant à savoir si l'intelligence artificielle générative est aussi révolutionnaire que les investisseurs l'avaient prévu à l'origine, a déclaré M. Siegel.
  Parallèlement, la Fed devrait lors de sa réunion de demain soir confirmer plus ou moins clairement la perspective d'une baisse des taux au mois de septembre, ce qui est plus positif pour les actions de valeur que pour les actions de croissance, selon Siegel.
  “Vous ne ferez pas bouger la valeur tant que la Fed ne baissera pas ses taux”, a-t-il résumé, ajoutant que cette baisse de taux pourrait se révéler être “un tournant dans la tendance que nous observons depuis de nombreux mois, voire de nombreuses années, à savoir que la croissance l'emporte sur la valeur”.
  L'économiste a également estimé que les données récentes sur l'inflation plaident aussi en faveur d'une baisse des taux, avec l'indice PCE qui a continué de reculer le mois dernier, alimentant l'espoir que les banquiers centraux assoupliront bientôt leur politique monétaire.
  “En ce qui concerne l'avenir, je pense que l'inflation est très, très bonne”, a déclaré M. Siegel, ajoutant qu'une hausse inattendue des prix ne modifierait pas la trajectoire descendante des taux cette année.
  Comment trouver les meilleures actions de valeur à acheter ?
  S'il était jusqu'à présent assez facile de suivre une stratégie de croissance en achetant des grandes actions technologiques de près ou de loin liées à l'IA, la nécessité de passer à une stratégie de valeur, comme le conseille Siegel, implique qu'il sera plus difficile de choisir les meilleures actions.
  En effet, lorsque l'on choisit des actions de croissance, c'est surtout le thème de l'activité et les perspectives d'avenir qui priment dans la valorisation, plutôt que les finances concrètes. Par contre, lorsque l'on choisit des actions de valeur, il est nécessaire de rentrer dans les détails de leurs finances pour identifier les plus sous-évaluées, et donc celles qui ont le plus fort potentiel haussier.
  ⚠️ InvestingPro est en soldes !
  ▶ Cliquez ici pour accéder à la réduction spéciale en plus des soldes d'été
  (réduction totale de -43%*) pour l'abonnement Pro de 1 an (qui revient à 7.4 euros par mois)
  Cela implique également qu'il faudra surveiller une gamme plus large d'action, alors que se concentrer sur les “7 Magnifiques” suffisait précédemment. Pour les investisseurs expérimentés en analyse fondamentale qui savent utiliser les screeners d'actions, cela ne sera pas un gros problème.
  Cependant, si vous êtes un investisseur débutant, ou que vous avez peu de connaissances en analyse financière, choisir les bonnes actions à acheter va devenir de plus en plus compliqué.
  Fort heureusement, l'IA apporte aujourd'hui des solutions bien concrètes à ces problèmes, en analysant des masses de données boursières et financières afin de construire des modèles prédictifs sans cesse mis à jour, et qui permettent de déboucher sur des recommandations d'achat et de vente concrètes et précises.
  C'est ce que propose ProPicks IA, un des services proposés aux abonnés InvestingPro. Il s'agit d'une intelligence artificielle développée par Investing.com qui gère 6 portefeuilles thématiques, dont un est actuellement particulièrement pertinent, puisqu'il se concentre sur les actions de valeur.
  La stratégie “Meilleures Actions de Valeur”, qui est mise à jour chaque mois lors du premier jour de bourse, rassemblent 20 actions évoluant sous leur valeur intrinsèque, et qui affichent un potentiel haussier conséquent.
  Cette stratégie a rapporté 932.7% sur les 10 dernières années, soit 648.8% de plus que le S&P 500, et pourrait donc être idéale pour vous permettre de maximiser vos gains face à la rotation des actions de croissance vers les actions de valeur.

stories.title: Les actions de valeur vont prendrele relais des big tech grâce à la Fed (économiste)

en.body:
Investment.com - While technological growth actions are losing power, many analysts are thinking about a rotation that would see the market increase to benefit more from other types of shares.
The decline in Fed rates will be the trigger for this trend-oriented reversal, according to economist Jeremy discoverer of Wharton School’s finance, which highlighted in a recent speech on HSBC the opportunities hidden in value actions.
• InvestingPro is in balance! Let the IA choose for you the best actions as more than 150,000 investors who over-intensify the market without effort! Add the revolution to less than EUR 8 per month in the future.
cumulative
summer balance and reduction reserved for our readers for one

* on the one-year subscription!
[ ]
► Click here to access the special reduction in summer balances
(total reduction of -43%*) for the Pro 1 year subscription (as at EUR 7.4 per month)
Doubts about the IA and the decline in Fed rates will help to shift growth to value
Let us remember that the frequency of investment related to the IA has until recently allowed major technological actions to be made more effective. However, doubts are mounting as to whether the creative artificial intelligence is as revolutionary as investors originally envisaged, Mr. discover.
At the same time, the Fed should confirm more or less clearly at its meeting tomorrow evening that rates will decline in September, which is more positive for value-taking than for growth shares, according to Nigel.
“We will not move the value until the Fed drops its rates,” he summarized, adding that this decline could prove to be “a turning point in the trend that we have seen for many months, even many years, that growth is on the edge of the economy.” ador”.
The economist also found that recent inflation data also favour a reduction in rates, with the ECB's continuing decline last month, fuelling hope that central bankers will soon be able to absorb their monetary policy.
“In terms of the future, I think inflation is very, very good,” said Mr. Nigel, adding that an unexpected rise in prices would not change the downward trajectory of rates this year.
How do I find the best value shares to buy?
If it was easy to follow a growth strategy by buying large technological actions close to or far related to the IA, the need to move to a value strategy, as advised by Nigel, means that it will be more difficult to choose the best actions. We are.
Indeed, when growth measures are chosen, it is primarily the subject of activity and prospects for the future that is at stake in appreciation, rather than the actual finances. However, when value-added shares are selected, it is necessary to go back to the details of their finances to identify the most undervalued, and therefore those with the highest potential to increase.
• InvestmentPro is in balance!

(total reduction of -43%*) for the Pro 1 year subscription (as at EUR 7.4 per month)
This also means that a broader range of actions will have to be monitored, while focusing on the “7 Magnificents” was previously sufficient. For investors experienced in basic analysis who know how to use the stock screens, this will not be a big problem.
However, if you are a starting investor, or you have little knowledge in financial analysis, choosing the right shares to buy will become increasingly complicated.
Fortunately, the IA is now providing very concrete solutions to these problems, analysing the mass of stock and financial data to build up-to-date pre-emptive models, which will enable concrete procurement and sales recommendations to be made. and specific.
This is what ProPix IA offers, one of the services offered to the InvestingPro subscribers. This is an artificial intelligence developed by Investment.com that manages 6 thematic portfolios, one of which is currently particularly relevant, as it focuses on value actions.
The “Meeler Value Actions” strategy, which is updated every month on the first day of the award, brings together 20 actions that are evolving under their intrinsic value, and which demonstrate a significant increase in potential.
This strategy has reported 932.7% over the last 10 years, 648.8% more than the S&P 500, and could therefore be ideal for you to maximize your gains in the face of the rotation of growth shares into value shares.
However, there is a taste for all of this in ProPix IA if this strategy does not convince you:

en.title: Value shares will take over big tech shares through the Fed ( Economist)

stories.body:
股市  Apple Intelligence的AI模型據報是在Google設計的處理器上進行預訓練  蘋果在周一為部分裝置釋出預覽版Apple Intelligence
 綜合外電報道，蘋果（Apple，美：AAPL）周一（29日）表示，支撐其人工智能AI系統Apple Intelligence的AI模型是在谷歌（Google）設計的處理器上進行預先訓練，反映大型科技公司正在尋找替代英偉達（NVIDIA，美：NVDA）芯片的方案。
  蘋果最新釋出的一份技術文件詳細介紹使用Google本土張量處理單元（Tensor Processing Unit，TPU）進行訓練。另外，蘋果在周一為部分裝置釋出預覽版Apple Intelligence。
  Nvidia GPU供不應求
  Nvidia昂貴圖形處理單元（GPU）一直佔據高階AI訓練芯片市場主導地位，在過去的幾年裡，需求量極之高，以至於很難採購所需數量。 OpenAI、微軟（Microsoft，美：MSFT）和 Anthropic 都在使用 Nvidia的 GPU 來建立他們的模型，而其他科技公司，包括 Google、Meta（美：META）、Oracle（美：ORCL） 和 Tesla（美：TSLA），則著加發展自家AI系統及產品。
  Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg和Alphabet（美: GOOGL） CEO Sundar Pichai上周都表示，他們的公司和該行業的其他人可能對AI基礎設施過度投資，但承認不這樣做的業務風險太高。Zuckerberg 曾受訪時稱，落後的風險是，你在未來 10 到 15 年最重要的技術中處於失勢位置。
  用Cloud TPU 集群訓練
  蘋果在其 47 頁的文件中沒有提及 Google 或 Nvidia，但指出了其蘋果基礎模型 (AFM) 和 AFM 伺服器是在「Cloud TPU 集群」上進行訓練，意味著蘋果租用雲服務提供商的伺服器來執行計算。蘋果在文件中說：「這個系統使我們能夠高效和可擴展地訓練 AFM 模型，包括 AFM-on-device、AFM-server 和更大的模型」
  周一蘋果推出Apple Intelligence測試版，該系統包括幾個新功能，如Siri重新整理外觀、更好的自然語言處理和文字欄位中AI生成的摘要。
  明年，蘋果計劃推出基於生成式AI的功能，包括影象生成、表情符號生成和可以訪問使用者個人資訊並在應用程式內採取行動的Powered Siri。
  Google 亦有用Nvidia 芯片
  蘋果在文件中表示，AFM on-device 是在一個由 2048 個 TPU v5p 芯片組成的「切片」上進行訓練，根據文件，AFM-server 是在 8192 個 TPU v4 芯片上進行訓練，這些芯片配置在一起作為數據中心網絡中的八個切片。
  根據 Google 的網站，最新的 TPU 在預先訂購三年的每小時使用成本不到 2 美元，谷歌於 2015 年首次推出其 TPU 用於內部工作負載，並於 2017 年向公眾提供，儘管如此，Google 是Nvidia 的大型客戶之一，公司在培訓AI系統時使用 Nvidia 的 GPU 和自家的 TPU，同時還在其雲平台上銷售對 Nvidia 技術的訪問權。
  蘋果此前表示，推理，即運行已預先訓練的AI模型以生成內容或進行預測，將部分在其自家芯片的數據中心上進行。
  SearchGPT｜OpenAI與Google正面交鋒 推AI搜尋功能「SearchGPT」 冀補ChatGPT哪短板？
  分析｜Google為何業績優但股價急挫？
  看文章 ・ 賺取 ET Points
  hket會員只要做齊報價專區任務並儲夠積分，就可以兌換高達$3000優惠券

stories.title: 美股焦點｜蘋果據報使用Google芯片訓練AI模型

en.body:
The Apple Intelligence model is based on Google's design of a training tool, which was released on Monday for part of Apple Intelligence.
Apple Intelligence's AI model, designed by Google, reflects the fact that big technology companies are looking for alternative UK chips, according to Apple, an AI model that runs through its artificial intelligence AI system, according to the Apple, 
A recent technical paper on the development of the Tensor Processing Unit, the PTU, was introduced in detail. In addition, Miango released Apple Intelligence for part of the game on Monday.
Nvidia GPU's non-request
Nvidia yung-o-o-geoform (GPU) has been the leader in high-level AI chip market, and in the past years demand has been extremely high and the amount of weight needed to buy is difficult. OpenAI, Microsoft, MSFT and Anthropic are using Nvidia's GPU to build their models, while other technology companies, including Google, Meta (US: META), Oracle (US: ORCL) and Tesla (US: TSLA), are developing their own AI and products.
Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai said last week that their companies and others concerned could invest in infrastructure in the AI base but that the business conditions that do not do so are too high. And the wind that was lost was that you lost your position in the most important technology of 10 to 15 years.
Training in the Cloud PTU cluster
In its document 47, Mémégo did not mention Google or Nvidia, but noted its base model (ARM) and AFM servo in training on the Cloud PTU cluster, meaning that the service providers hired the mermaids to perform the calculation. And MYYO said in the document, "This system allows us to train the AFM model with a high efficiency and scale, including AFM-on-dvice, AFM-server and larger models."
The Apple Intelligence test version, which features several new features, such as Siri's re-ordering of tactile, better natural language and a summary of AI in the text-positioning section, was introduced Monday.
Next year, MYM will launch its own AI-based function, including image generation, facial expression generation and personal user-driven Googled Siri, which is a user-friendly application-driven action.

en.title: U.S. stock price | MYYYYYYYY | Use Google chip training AI model

stories.body:
By Manali Pradhan – Jul 29, 2024 at 8:15PM  Key Points  Alphabet is leveraging advanced AI capabilities to strengthen its core search and cloud offerings.
 Oracle has emerged as a major data center infrastructure provider for companies training large language models.
  Alphabet and Oracle have more room to run.
  The U.S. stock market has seen multiple ups and downs in the past decade. While trends such as e-commerce, blockchain, cryptocurrency, cannabis, and cloud computing have influenced the market, none may have as far-reaching effects as the artificial intelligence (AI) trend. According to a forecast from Statista, the global AI market could grow at a compound annual rate of 28.46% from $184 billion in 2024 to $826.7 billion in 2030.
  Not surprisingly, the AI exposure of many companies has driven their stocks to dizzying highs. However, some AI-powered stocks such as Alphabet GOOG GOOGL and Oracle ORCL may still have enough upside potential to make them top picks to buy now and hold for the long run.
  1. Alphabet
  Digital advertising titan Alphabet -- owner of Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, the Android mobile operating system, and the recently launched Gemini large language model -- has been facing several AI-associated challenges in recent times.
    Key Data Points
  The advancements made by OpenAI and Microsoft in generative AI have been disruptive for Alphabet's core Google search business. However, to withstand these pressures, Alphabet launched its own generative artificial intelligence-based family of Gemini models. The family comprises models of four different sizes, each designed for its own set of use cases and suited for different deployment environments. Gemini 1.5 Pro can handle 2 million tokens -- which is the longest context window of any large-scale foundational model to date. Gemini can process various forms of data inputs including text, audio, images, and video, and can allow complex interactions. Gemini enables developers to create applications requiring extensive context for various use cases. Gemini has been integrated across all of Alphabet's core offerings to improve their overall user experiences.
  The company is now rolling out AI Overviews (an advanced AI-powered feature powered by the Gemini model) in its Google Search offering. Besides seeing positive trends in the testing phase in search usage and user satisfaction, the company also noted higher user engagement from users aged 18 to 24 when Google Search was combined with AI overviews. Alphabet has also expanded the types of queries it can answer with AI features such as Visual Search via Lens and Circle to Search on 100 million Android mobile devices.
  Among the signs that these features are helping the company maintain its search market dominance, revenues from the "Google Search & other" business segment jumped by 13.8% year over year in the second quarter.
  Alphabet's Google Cloud business crossed the $10 billion quarterly revenue mark for the first time in the second quarter and generated over $1 billion in operating profit. YouTube also remains a major growth driver, and in June, it extended its streak as the most-watched streaming platform on U.S. televisions to 17 consecutive months. YouTube is benefiting from rising viewer engagement and the increasing shift of advertising budgets from linear television to connected television. Alphabet is also making progress in monetizing its short-form video offering, Shorts.
  Alphabet had $101 billion in cash and marketable securities on its books at the end of the second quarter, and it generated $60.8 billion in free cash flow over the past four reported quarters. Despite this, the company trades at a price-to-sales multiple of 6.75, significantly lower than many AI companies.
  Considering its many AI-powered growth catalysts, its robust financials, and its currently reasonable valuation, Alphabet may deliver top-notch results in the coming years for investors who buy it now.
  2. Oracle
  As one of the world's best AI data center infrastructure players, Oracle is benefiting dramatically from increasing demand for the computing power and storage required to train large language models.
    Key Data Points
  The explosive growth in demand for Oracle's cloud services pushed its remaining performance obligation (a measure of order backlog) up by 44% year over year to $98 billion in the fourth quarter of its fiscal 2024 (which ended March 31). The company's revenues rose by just 6% to $53 billion. However, management is guiding for double-digit percentage revenue growth in its fiscal 2025, and anticipates revenues from cloud infrastructure services will soar even faster than the 50% growth reported in fiscal 2024.
  Oracle's cloud infrastructure services and enterprise applications are widely considered more cost-effective, faster, and secure than those of their competitors in training large language models. The company also offers multiple deployment options, including public cloud, multicloud, sovereign cloud, and even dedicated cloud.
  Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia , Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers. It is seeing a dramatic increase in sales momentum, and so far in 2024, it has signed more than 30 AI contracts worth a total of nearly $17 billion.
  Oracle recently launched Exadata Exascale, a cost-effective and intelligent data architecture for high-performance cloud computing. This will help it target more cost-sensitive customers.
  The last impressive factor for Oracle is that the stock is currently trading at 7 times trailing 12-month sales, lower than the software industry's median sales multiple of 9. At this reasonable valuation, the stock seems like a worthwhile pick for smart buyers.
  Premium Investing Services
  Invest better with The Motley Fool. Get stock recommendations, portfolio guidance, and more from The Motley Fool's premium services.

sentences: By Manali Pradhan – Jul 29, 2024 at 8:15PM  Key Points  Alphabet is leveraging advanced AI capabilities to strengthen its core search and cloud offerings.

Alphabet
  Digital advertising titan Alphabet -- owner of Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, the Android mobile operating system, and the recently launched Gemini large language model -- has been facing several AI-associated challenges in recent times.
The company is now rolling out AI Overviews (an advanced AI-powered feature powered by the Gemini model) in its Google Search offering.

Oracle
  As one of the world's best AI data center infrastructure players, Oracle is benefiting dramatically from increasing demand for the computing power and storage required to train large language models.
Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia , Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers.

sentences: The U.S. stock market has seen multiple ups and downs in the past decade.

According to a forecast from Statista, the global AI market could grow at a compound annual rate of 28.46% from $184 billion in 2024 to $826.7 billion in 2030.Not surprisingly, the AI exposure of many companies has driven their stocks to dizzying highs.

However, some AI-powered stocks such as Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) and Oracle (NYSE: ORCL) may still have enough upside potential to make them top picks to buy
 and hold for the long run.

stories.title: 2 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy Hand over Fist Right Now

stories.body:
InvestorPlace - Stock Market News, Stock Advice & Trading Tips  Palantir (NYSE: PLTR ) stock is up notably this year thanks to commercial
income, which has increased significantly, therefore offsetting its strong dependence on government contracts.
  Palantir, often under the scanner for its relations with the defense establishment, is now quietly creating quite a reputation within the commercial sphere. One main driver of this expansion is Palantir's AI platform, which companies are progressively using. Palantir is also qualified for inclusion in the S&P 500 as it has four straight quarters of GAAP profitability , therefore improving the stock performance even more.
  What's more, there is a certain section of investors that will highly value Palantir for its agreements with the U.S. Department of Defense. This kind of consistent, recurrent cash flow is highly coveted.
  But considering the year-to-date gain of 63%, Palantir stock is overvalued by most major metrics, making it the ideal time to part ways with a certain portion of your holdings and invest in companies with upside potential not realized in the current market.
  Palantir stock has seen several highs and lows this year. The stock struggles at $30; it retreats whenever it nears that level; resistance is $20. Selling Palantir shares at $27.18 makes sense.
  Impressive Growth and Strategic Alliances
  Source: shutterstock.com/ex_artist
  Palantir shares saw double-digit gains in the first half of the year. However, knowing why is crucial.
  Palantir Gotham, Apollo, and Foundry have used big data for years. Still, Palantir's main offering is its AI Platform. AIP helps organizations grow AI models with over 1300 Bootcamps globally.
  The Model Catalog, introduced in April, enables users to browse Palantir models in AIP. Companies may easily integrate and apply AI models for several purposes using this technology.
  In July, AIP Logic Evaluations provided dependable, high-quality AI process outcomes. This tool lets users properly test and certify AI models for production use.
  In addition, Palantir and Voyager Space are collaborating to enhance military research, communications, and space and defense intelligence. The partnership manages International Space Station payloads and creates a “Customer Hub” for expedited requests using Palantir's Foundry and AI technology.
  Carahsoft and Palantir provide mission-critical software to the Canadian government. Canadian government organizations may better use Palantir's AI-powered financial crime prevention and healthcare delivery solutions by collaborating.
  Oracle (NYSE: ORCL ) and Palantir are also collaborating . Through this partnership, Palantir's AI and data analytics skills and Oracle's cloud infrastructure accelerate AI adoption across sectors.
  These activities keep Palantir expanding. Palantir's commercial contracts earned $299 million in Q1 2024, up 27% year over year. Palantir added $150 million in U.S. commercial revenue, up 40% year over year.
  Government Contracts Bolstering Revenue
  Source: iQoncept / Shutterstock
  Palantir recently received a $480 million contract from the Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office of the Pentagon to develop and incorporate artificial intelligence technology across many DoD platforms. This covers a $153 million first purchase for the Joint Staff and for implementing the Maven Smart System at certain combatant commands.
  Additionally, Palantir won a $178.4 million contract for the development of the next-generation targeting system, Tactical Intelligence Targeting Access Node. This system links Army units with high-altitude and space sensors to provide thorough targeting data.
  Palantir secured several contracts from the US Air Force totaling more than $100 million to offer data-as-a-service platforms. Among other sites, these systems will assist mission-critical activities at the National Space Defense Center and the Combined Space Activities Center.
  Palantir, in total, earned $335 million from government contracts in Q1 2024, a 16% year-over-year increase shown in. Recent noteworthy government contracts include a $480 million contract for the Maven Smart System prototype from the Department of Defense, a $178 million contract for the Army's Tactical Intelligence Targeting Access Node, and several smaller contracts totaling roughly $169 million in recent months.
  Palantir Stock Faces Skepticism Amid High Valuation
  Source: Spyro the Dragon / Shutterstock.com
  A number of eminent experts have made pessimistic comments about Palantir shares. Concerned about what he sees as an “unprecedented generative AI hype cycle” and the stock's high valuation multiples, Brian White of Monness, Crespi, & Hardt recently downgraded Palantir stock to a “strong sell.”
  More general market questions also surround Palantir's valuation and its dependence on government contracts. Though its commercial business expansion and artificial intelligence projects show promise, doubts about its long-term profitability and market positioning persist.
  With a price-to-earnings ratio of 226.5x, Palantir stock is worse than 95% of the 1,531 software companies that were looked at. Execution is not the issue for Palantir. However, as White says, Palantir stock is trading at “an egregiously rich valuation.”
  White's analysis mirrors the consensus opinion on Palantir stock as well; the stock holds a consensus rating of “Hold,” and the average price target is $22.42, representing a 17.5% downside from the current price of $27.18.
  With the way things are, it's worth selling a portion of your Palantir stock and investing in other growth areas.
  On the date of publication, the responsible editor did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article.
  On the date of publication, Faizan Farooque did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines
  Faizan Farooque is a contributing author for InvestorPlace.com and numerous other financial sites. Faizan has several years of experience in analyzing the stock market and was a former data journalist at S&P Global Market Intelligence. His passion is to help the average investor make more informed decisions regarding their portfolio.
  More From InvestorPlace
  Legendary Investor Predicts: “Forget AI... THIS Technology Is the Future”
  The post PLTR Alert: Sell Palantir Stock as AI Hype Inflates Valuations appeared first on InvestorPlace
  SHARE THIS POST
  Your Market View

stories.title: PLTR Alert: Sell Palantir Stock as AI Hype Inflates Valuations

stories.body:
Palantir ‘s ( PLTR ) stock surged due to a significant rise in commercial income driven by its AI platform.
Palantir (NYSE: PLTR ) stock is up notably this year thanks to commercial income, which has increased significantly, therefore offsetting its strong dependence on government contracts.
 Palantir, often under the scanner for its relations with the defense establishment, is now quietly creating quite a reputation within the commercial sphere. One main driver of this expansion is Palantir’s AI platform, which companies are progressively using. Palantir is also qualified for inclusion in the S&P 500 as it has four straight quarters of GAAP profitability, therefore improving the stock performance even more.
 What’s more, there is a certain section of investors that will highly value Palantir for its agreements with the U.S. Department of Defense. This kind of consistent, recurrent cash flow is highly coveted.
 But considering the year-to-date gain of 63%, Palantir stock is overvalued by most major metrics, making it the ideal time to part ways with a certain portion of your holdings and invest in companies with upside potential not realized in the current market.
 Palantir stock has seen several highs and lows this year. The stock struggles at $30; it retreats whenever it nears that level; resistance is $20. Selling Palantir shares at $27.18 makes sense.
 Impressive Growth and Strategic Alliances
 Source: shutterstock.com/ex_artist
 Palantir shares saw double-digit gains in the first half of the year. However, knowing why is crucial.
 Palantir Gotham, Apollo, and Foundry have used big data for years. Still, Palantir’s main offering is its AI Platform. AIP helps organizations grow AI models with over 1300 Bootcamps globally.
 The Model Catalog, introduced in April, enables users to browse Palantir models in AIP. Companies may easily integrate and apply AI models for several purposes using this technology.
 In July, AIP Logic Evaluations provided dependable, high-quality AI process outcomes. This tool lets users properly test and certify AI models for production use.
 In addition, Palantir and Voyager Space are collaborating to enhance military research, communications, and space and defense intelligence. The partnership manages International Space Station payloads and creates a “Customer Hub” for expedited requests using Palantir’s Foundry and AI technology.
 Carahsoft and Palantir provide mission-critical software to the Canadian government. Canadian government organizations may better use Palantir’s AI-powered financial crime prevention and healthcare delivery solutions by collaborating.
 Oracle (NYSE: ORCL ) and Palantir are also collaborating. Through this partnership, Palantir’s AI and data analytics skills and Oracle’s cloud infrastructure accelerate AI adoption across sectors.
 These activities keep Palantir expanding. Palantir’s commercial contracts earned $299 million in Q1 2024, up 27% year over year. Palantir added $150 million in U.S. commercial revenue, up 40% year over year.
 Government Contracts Bolstering Revenue
 Source: iQoncept / Shutterstock
 Palantir recently received a $480 million contract from the Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office of the Pentagon to develop and incorporate artificial intelligence technology across many DoD platforms. This covers a $153 million first purchase for the Joint Staff and for implementing the Maven Smart System at certain combatant commands.
 Additionally, Palantir won a $178.4 million contract for the development of the next-generation targeting system, Tactical Intelligence Targeting Access Node. This system links Army units with high-altitude and space sensors to provide thorough targeting data.
 Palantir secured several contracts from the US Air Force totaling more than $100 million to offer data-as-a-service platforms. Among other sites, these systems will assist mission-critical activities at the National Space Defense Center and the Combined Space Activities Center.
 Palantir, in total, earned $335 million from government contracts in Q1 2024, a 16% year-over-year increase shown in. Recent noteworthy government contracts include a $480 million contract for the Maven Smart System prototype from the Department of Defense, a $178 million contract for the Army’s Tactical Intelligence Targeting Access Node, and several smaller contracts totaling roughly $169 million in recent months.
 Palantir Stock Faces Skepticism Amid High Valuation
 Source: Spyro the Dragon / Shutterstock.com
 A number of eminent experts have made pessimistic comments about Palantir shares. Concerned about what he sees as an “unprecedented generative AI hype cycle” and the stock’s high valuation multiples, Brian White of Monness, Crespi, & Hardt recently downgraded Palantir stock to a “strong sell.”
 More general market questions also surround Palantir’s valuation and its dependence on government contracts. Though its commercial business expansion and artificial intelligence projects show promise, doubts about its long-term profitability and market positioning persist.
 With a price-to-earnings ratio of 226.5x, Palantir stock is worse than 95% of the 1,531 software companies that were looked at. Execution is not the issue for Palantir. However, as White says, Palantir stock is trading at “an egregiously rich valuation.”
 White’s analysis mirrors the consensus opinion on Palantir stock as well; the stock holds a consensus rating of “Hold,” and the average price target is $22.42, representing a 17.5% downside from the current price of $27.18.
 With the way things are, it’s worth selling a portion of your Palantir stock and investing in other growth areas.
 On the date of publication, the responsible editor did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article.
 On the date of publication, Faizan Farooque did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines.
 Faizan Farooque is a contributing author for InvestorPlace.com and numerous other financial sites. Faizan has several years of experience in analyzing the stock market and was a former data journalist at S&P Global Market Intelligence. His passion is to help the average investor make more informed decisions regarding their portfolio.

stories.title: PLTR Alert: Sell Palantir Stock as AI Hype Inflates Valuations

stories.body:
The U.S. stock market has seen multiple ups and downs in the past decade. While trends such as e-commerce, blockchain, cryptocurrency, cannabis, and
cloud computing have influenced the market, none may have as far-reaching effects as the artificial intelligence (AI) trend. According to a forecast from Statista, the global AI market could grow at a compound annual rate of 28.46% from $184 billion in 2024 to $826.7 billion in 2030.
  Not surprisingly, the AI exposure of many companies has driven their stocks to dizzying highs. However, some AI-powered stocks such as Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG (NASDAQ: GOOGL and Oracle (NYSE: ORCL may still have enough upside potential to make them top picks to buy now and hold for the long run.
  1. Alphabet
  Digital advertising titan Alphabet -- owner of Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, the Android mobile operating system, and the recently launched Gemini large language model -- has been facing several AI-associated challenges in recent times.
  The advancements made by OpenAI and Microsoft in generative AI have been disruptive for Alphabet's core Google search business. However, to withstand these pressures, Alphabet launched its own generative artificial intelligence-based family of Gemini models. The family comprises models of four different sizes, each designed for its own set of use cases and suited for different deployment environments. Gemini 1.5 Pro can handle 2 million tokens -- which is the longest context window of any large-scale foundational model to date. Gemini can process various forms of data inputs including text, audio, images, and video, and can allow complex interactions. Gemini enables developers to create applications requiring extensive context for various use cases. Gemini has been integrated across all of Alphabet's core offerings to improve their overall user experiences.
  The company is now rolling out AI Overviews (an advanced AI-powered feature powered by the Gemini model) in its Google Search offering. Besides seeing positive trends in the testing phase in search usage and user satisfaction, the company also noted higher user engagement from users aged 18 to 24 when Google Search was combined with AI overviews. Alphabet has also expanded the types of queries it can answer with AI features such as Visual Search via Lens and Circle to Search on 100 million Android mobile devices.
  Among the signs that these features are helping the company maintain its search market dominance, revenues from the "Google Search & other" business segment jumped by 13.8% year over year in the second quarter.
  Alphabet's Google Cloud business crossed the $10 billion quarterly revenue mark for the first time in the second quarter and generated over $1 billion in operating profit. YouTube also remains a major growth driver, and in June, it extended its streak as the most-watched streaming platform on U.S. televisions to 17 consecutive months. YouTube is benefiting from rising viewer engagement and the increasing shift of advertising budgets from linear television to connected television. Alphabet is also making progress in monetizing its short-form video offering, Shorts.
  Alphabet had $101 billion in cash and marketable securities on its books at the end of the second quarter, and it generated $60.8 billion in free cash flow over the past four reported quarters. Despite this, the company trades at a price-to-sales multiple of 6.75, significantly lower than many AI companies.
  Considering its many AI-powered growth catalysts, its robust financials, and its currently reasonable valuation, Alphabet may deliver top-notch results in the coming years for investors who buy it now.
  2. Oracle
  As one of the world's best AI data center infrastructure players, Oracle is benefiting dramatically from increasing demand for the computing power and storage required to train large language models.
  The explosive growth in demand for Oracle's cloud services pushed its remaining performance obligation (a measure of order backlog) up by 44% year over year to $98 billion in the fourth quarter of its fiscal 2024 (which ended March 31). The company's revenues rose by just 6% to $53 billion. However, management is guiding for double-digit percentage revenue growth in its fiscal 2025, and anticipates revenues from cloud infrastructure services will soar even faster than the 50% growth reported in fiscal 2024.
  Oracle's cloud infrastructure services and enterprise applications are widely considered more cost-effective, faster, and secure than those of their competitors in training large language models. The company also offers multiple deployment options, including public cloud, multicloud, sovereign cloud, and even dedicated cloud.
  Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia , Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers. It is seeing a dramatic increase in sales momentum, and so far in 2024, it has signed more than 30 AI contracts worth a total of nearly $17 billion.
  Oracle recently launched Exadata Exascale, a cost-effective and intelligent data architecture for high-performance cloud computing. This will help it target more cost-sensitive customers.
  The last impressive factor for Oracle is that the stock is currently trading at 7 times trailing 12-month sales, lower than the software industry's median sales multiple of 9. At this reasonable valuation, the stock seems like a worthwhile pick for smart buyers.
  Should you invest $1,000 in Alphabet right now?
  Before you buy stock in Alphabet, consider this:
  The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now… and Alphabet wasn't one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.
  Consider when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you'd have $692,784
   Stock Advisor provides investors with an easy-to-follow blueprint for success, including guidance on building a portfolio, regular updates from analysts, and two new stock picks each month. The Stock Advisor service has more than quadrupled the return of S&P 500 since 2002*.
  See the 10 stocks »
  *Stock Advisor returns as of July 29, 2024
  Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors. Manali Pradhan has no position in any of the stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Alphabet, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Oracle. The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft and short January 2026 $405 calls on Microsoft. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy

Alphabet

Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia , Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers.

However, some AI-powered stocks such as Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG (NASDAQ: GOOGL and Oracle (NYSE: ORCL may still have enough upside potential to make them top picks to buy now and hold for the long run.

stories.title: 2 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy Hand over Fist Right Now

stories.body:
Alphabet and Oracle have more room to run.

The U.S. stock market has seen multiple ups and downs in the past decade. While trends such as e-commerce, blockchain, cryptocurrency, cannabis, and cloud computing have influenced the market, none may have as far-reaching effects as the artificial intelligence (AI) trend. According to a forecast from Statista, the global AI market could grow at a compound annual rate of 28.46% from $184 billion in 2024 to $826.7 billion in 2030.

Not surprisingly, the AI exposure of many companies has driven their stocks to dizzying highs. However, some AI-powered stocks such as Alphabet (GOOG 1.45%) (GOOGL 1.51%) and Oracle (ORCL -0.50%) may still have enough upside potential to make them top picks to buy now and hold for the long run.

1. Alphabet

Digital advertising titan Alphabet -- owner of Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, the Android mobile operating system, and the recently launched Gemini large language model -- has been facing several AI-associated challenges in recent times.

The advancements made by OpenAI and Microsoft in generative AI have been disruptive for Alphabet's core Google search business. However, to withstand these pressures, Alphabet launched its own generative artificial intelligence-based family of Gemini models. The family comprises models of four different sizes, each designed for its own set of use cases and suited for different deployment environments. Gemini 1.5 Pro can handle 2 million tokens -- which is the longest context window of any large-scale foundational model to date. Gemini can process various forms of data inputs including text, audio, images, and video, and can allow complex interactions. Gemini enables developers to create applications requiring extensive context for various use cases. Gemini has been integrated across all of Alphabet's core offerings to improve their overall user experiences.

The company is now rolling out AI Overviews (an advanced AI-powered feature powered by the Gemini model) in its Google Search offering. Besides seeing positive trends in the testing phase in search usage and user satisfaction, the company also noted higher user engagement from users aged 18 to 24 when Google Search was combined with AI overviews. Alphabet has also expanded the types of queries it can answer with AI features such as Visual Search via Lens and Circle to Search on 100 million Android mobile devices.

Among the signs that these features are helping the company maintain its search market dominance, revenues from the "Google Search & other" business segment jumped by 13.8% year over year in the second quarter.

Alphabet's Google Cloud business crossed the $10 billion quarterly revenue mark for the first time in the second quarter and generated over $1 billion in operating profit. YouTube also remains a major growth driver, and in June, it extended its streak as the most-watched streaming platform on U.S. televisions to 17 consecutive months. YouTube is benefiting from rising viewer engagement and the increasing shift of advertising budgets from linear television to connected television. Alphabet is also making progress in monetizing its short-form video offering, Shorts.

Alphabet had $101 billion in cash and marketable securities on its books at the end of the second quarter, and it generated $60.8 billion in free cash flow over the past four reported quarters. Despite this, the company trades at a price-to-sales multiple of 6.75, significantly lower than many AI companies.

Considering its many AI-powered growth catalysts, its robust financials, and its currently reasonable valuation, Alphabet may deliver top-notch results in the coming years for investors who buy it now.

2. Oracle

As one of the world's best AI data center infrastructure players, Oracle is benefiting dramatically from increasing demand for the computing power and storage required to train large language models.

The explosive growth in demand for Oracle's cloud services pushed its remaining performance obligation (a measure of order backlog) up by 44% year over year to $98 billion in the fourth quarter of its fiscal 2024 (which ended March 31). The company's revenues rose by just 6% to $53 billion. However, management is guiding for double-digit percentage revenue growth in its fiscal 2025, and anticipates revenues from cloud infrastructure services will soar even faster than the 50% growth reported in fiscal 2024.

Oracle's cloud infrastructure services and enterprise applications are widely considered more cost-effective, faster, and secure than those of their competitors in training large language models. The company also offers multiple deployment options, including public cloud, multicloud, sovereign cloud, and even dedicated cloud.

Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers. It is seeing a dramatic increase in sales momentum, and so far in 2024, it has signed more than 30 AI contracts worth a total of nearly $17 billion.

Oracle recently launched Exadata Exascale, a cost-effective and intelligent data architecture for high-performance cloud computing. This will help it target more cost-sensitive customers.

The last impressive factor for Oracle is that the stock is currently trading at 7 times trailing 12-month sales, lower than the software industry's median sales multiple of 9. At this reasonable valuation, the stock seems like a worthwhile pick for smart buyers.

sentences:
Alphabet and Oracle have more room to run.

Alphabet

Digital advertising titan Alphabet -- owner of Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, the Android mobile operating system, and the recently launched Gemini large language model -- has been facing several AI-associated challenges in recent times.

The company is now rolling out AI Overviews (an advanced AI-powered feature powered by the Gemini model) in its Google Search offering.
Not surprisingly, prominent tech companies such as OpenAI, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet use Oracle's cloud services and data centers.
Oracle

As one of the world's best AI data center infrastructure players, Oracle is benefiting dramatically from increasing demand for the computing power and storage required to train large language models.
